179#define s6_addr32 __u6_addr.__u6_addr32 /* Non-standard */
180
181/* global vars */
182ipv6cp_options ipv6cp_wantoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that we want to request */
183ipv6cp_options ipv6cp_gotoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that peer ack'd */
184ipv6cp_options ipv6cp_allowoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options we allow peer to request */
185ipv6cp_options ipv6cp_hisoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that we ack'd */
186int no_ifaceid_neg = 0;
187
188/* local vars */
189static int ipv6cp_is_up;
190
191/* Hook for a plugin to know when IPv6 protocol has come up */
192void (*ipv6_up_hook) __P((void)) = NULL;
193
194/* Hook for a plugin to know when IPv6 protocol has come down */
195void (*ipv6_down_hook) __P((void)) = NULL;
196
197/* Notifiers for when IPCPv6 goes up and down */
198struct notifier *ipv6_up_notifier = NULL;
199struct notifier *ipv6_down_notifier = NULL;
200
201/*
202 * Callbacks for fsm code. (CI = Configuration Information)
203 */
204static void ipv6cp_resetci __P((fsm *)); /* Reset our CI */
205static int ipv6cp_cilen __P((fsm *)); /* Return length of our CI */
206static void ipv6cp_addci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int *)); /* Add our CI */
207static int ipv6cp_ackci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int)); /* Peer ack'd our CI */
208static int ipv6cp_nakci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int, int));/* Peer nak'd our CI */
209static int ipv6cp_rejci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int)); /* Peer rej'd our CI */
210static int ipv6cp_reqci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int *, int)); /* Rcv CI */
211static void ipv6cp_up __P((fsm *)); /* We're UP */
212static void ipv6cp_down __P((fsm *)); /* We're DOWN */
213static void ipv6cp_finished __P((fsm *)); /* Don't need lower layer */
214
215fsm ipv6cp_fsm[NUM_PPP]; /* IPV6CP fsm structure */
216
217static fsm_callbacks ipv6cp_callbacks = { /* IPV6CP callback routines */
218 ipv6cp_resetci, /* Reset our Configuration Information */
219 ipv6cp_cilen, /* Length of our Configuration Information */
220 ipv6cp_addci, /* Add our Configuration Information */
221 ipv6cp_ackci, /* ACK our Configuration Information */
222 ipv6cp_nakci, /* NAK our Configuration Information */
223 ipv6cp_rejci, /* Reject our Configuration Information */
224 ipv6cp_reqci, /* Request peer's Configuration Information */
225 ipv6cp_up, /* Called when fsm reaches OPENED state */
226 ipv6cp_down, /* Called when fsm leaves OPENED state */
227 NULL, /* Called when we want the lower layer up */
228 ipv6cp_finished, /* Called when we want the lower layer down */
229 NULL, /* Called when Protocol-Reject received */
230 NULL, /* Retransmission is necessary */
231 NULL, /* Called to handle protocol-specific codes */
232 "IPV6CP" /* String name of protocol */
233};
234
235/*
236 * Command-line options.
237 */
238static int setifaceid __P((char **arg));
239static void printifaceid __P((option_t *,
240 void (*)(void *, char *, ...), void *));
241
242static option_t ipv6cp_option_list[] = {
243 { "ipv6", o_special, (void *)setifaceid,
244 "Set interface identifiers for IPV6",
245 OPT_A2PRINTER, (void *)printifaceid },
246
247 { "+ipv6", o_bool, &ipv6cp_protent.enabled_flag,
248 "Enable IPv6 and IPv6CP", OPT_PRIO | 1 },
249 { "noipv6", o_bool, &ipv6cp_protent.enabled_flag,
250 "Disable IPv6 and IPv6CP", OPT_PRIOSUB },
251 { "-ipv6", o_bool, &ipv6cp_protent.enabled_flag,
252 "Disable IPv6 and IPv6CP", OPT_PRIOSUB | OPT_ALIAS },
253
254 { "ipv6cp-accept-local", o_bool, &ipv6cp_allowoptions[0].accept_local,
255 "Accept peer's interface identifier for us", 1 },
256
257 { "ipv6cp-use-ipaddr", o_bool, &ipv6cp_allowoptions[0].use_ip,
258 "Use (default) IPv4 address as interface identifier", 1 },
259
260 { "ipv6cp-use-persistent", o_bool, &ipv6cp_wantoptions[0].use_persistent,
261 "Use uniquely-available persistent value for link local address", 1 },
262
263 { "ipv6cp-restart", o_int, &ipv6cp_fsm[0].timeouttime,
264 "Set timeout for IPv6CP", OPT_PRIO },
265 { "ipv6cp-max-terminate", o_int, &ipv6cp_fsm[0].maxtermtransmits,
266 "Set max #xmits for term-reqs", OPT_PRIO },
267 { "ipv6cp-max-configure", o_int, &ipv6cp_fsm[0].maxconfreqtransmits,
268 "Set max #xmits for conf-reqs", OPT_PRIO },
269 { "ipv6cp-max-failure", o_int, &ipv6cp_fsm[0].maxnakloops,
270 "Set max #conf-naks for IPv6CP", OPT_PRIO },
271
272 { NULL }
273};

276/*
277 * Protocol entry points from main code.
278 */
279static void ipv6cp_init __P((int));
280static void ipv6cp_open __P((int));
281static void ipv6cp_close __P((int, char *));
282static void ipv6cp_lowerup __P((int));
283static void ipv6cp_lowerdown __P((int));
284static void ipv6cp_input __P((int, u_char *, int));
285static void ipv6cp_protrej __P((int));
286static int ipv6cp_printpkt __P((u_char *, int,
287 void (*) __P((void *, char *, ...)), void *));
288static void ipv6_check_options __P((void));
289static int ipv6_demand_conf __P((int));
290static int ipv6_active_pkt __P((u_char *, int));
291
292struct protent ipv6cp_protent = {
293 PPP_IPV6CP,
294 ipv6cp_init,
295 ipv6cp_input,
296 ipv6cp_protrej,
297 ipv6cp_lowerup,
298 ipv6cp_lowerdown,
299 ipv6cp_open,
300 ipv6cp_close,
301 ipv6cp_printpkt,
302 NULL,
303 0,
304 "IPV6CP",
305 "IPV6",
306 ipv6cp_option_list,
307 ipv6_check_options,
308 ipv6_demand_conf,
309 ipv6_active_pkt
310};
311
312static void ipv6cp_clear_addrs __P((int, eui64_t, eui64_t));
313static void ipv6cp_script __P((char *));
314static void ipv6cp_script_done __P((void *));
315
316/*
317 * Lengths of configuration options.
318 */
319#define CILEN_VOID 2
320#define CILEN_COMPRESS 4 /* length for RFC2023 compress opt. */
321#define CILEN_IFACEID 10 /* RFC2472, interface identifier */
322
323#define CODENAME(x) ((x) == CONFACK ? "ACK" : \
324 (x) == CONFNAK ? "NAK" : "REJ")
325
326/*
327 * This state variable is used to ensure that we don't
328 * run an ipcp-up/down script while one is already running.
329 */
330static enum script_state {
331 s_down,
332 s_up,
333} ipv6cp_script_state;
334static pid_t ipv6cp_script_pid;
335
336/*
337 * setifaceid - set the interface identifiers manually
338 */
339static int
340setifaceid(argv)
341 char **argv;
342{
343 char *comma, *arg, c;
344 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[0];
345 struct in6_addr addr;
346 static int prio_local, prio_remote;
347
348#define VALIDID(a) ( (((a).s6_addr32[0] == 0) && ((a).s6_addr32[1] == 0)) && \
349 (((a).s6_addr32[2] != 0) || ((a).s6_addr32[3] != 0)) )
350
351 arg = *argv;
352 if ((comma = strchr(arg, ',')) == NULL)
353 comma = arg + strlen(arg);
354
355 /*
356 * If comma first character, then no local identifier
357 */
358 if (comma != arg) {
359 c = *comma;
360 *comma = '\0';
361
362 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, arg, &addr) == 0 || !VALIDID(addr)) {
363 option_error("Illegal interface identifier (local): %s", arg);
364 return 0;
365 }
366
367 if (option_priority >= prio_local) {
368 eui64_copy(addr.s6_addr32[2], wo->ourid);
369 wo->opt_local = 1;
370 prio_local = option_priority;
371 }
372 *comma = c;
373 }
374
375 /*
376 * If comma last character, the no remote identifier
377 */
378 if (*comma != 0 && *++comma != '\0') {
379 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, comma, &addr) == 0 || !VALIDID(addr)) {
380 option_error("Illegal interface identifier (remote): %s", comma);
381 return 0;
382 }
383 if (option_priority >= prio_remote) {
384 eui64_copy(addr.s6_addr32[2], wo->hisid);
385 wo->opt_remote = 1;
386 prio_remote = option_priority;
387 }
388 }
389
390 if (override_value("+ipv6", option_priority, option_source))
391 ipv6cp_protent.enabled_flag = 1;
392 return 1;
393}
394
395char *llv6_ntoa(eui64_t ifaceid);
396
397static void
398printifaceid(opt, printer, arg)
399 option_t *opt;
400 void (*printer) __P((void *, char *, ...));
401 void *arg;
402{
403 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[0];
404
405 if (wo->opt_local)
406 printer(arg, "%s", llv6_ntoa(wo->ourid));
407 printer(arg, ",");
408 if (wo->opt_remote)
409 printer(arg, "%s", llv6_ntoa(wo->hisid));
410}
411
412/*
413 * Make a string representation of a network address.
414 */
415char *
416llv6_ntoa(ifaceid)
417 eui64_t ifaceid;
418{
419 static char b[64];
420
421 snprintf(b, sizeof(b), "fe80::%s", eui64_ntoa(ifaceid));
422 return b;
423}
424
425
426/*
427 * ipv6cp_init - Initialize IPV6CP.
428 */
429static void
430ipv6cp_init(unit)
431 int unit;
432{
433 fsm *f = &ipv6cp_fsm[unit];
434 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[unit];
435 ipv6cp_options *ao = &ipv6cp_allowoptions[unit];
436
437 f->unit = unit;
438 f->protocol = PPP_IPV6CP;
439 f->callbacks = &ipv6cp_callbacks;
440 fsm_init(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit]);
441
442 memset(wo, 0, sizeof(*wo));
443 memset(ao, 0, sizeof(*ao));
444
445 wo->accept_local = 1;
446 wo->neg_ifaceid = 1;
447 ao->neg_ifaceid = 1;
448
449#ifdef IPV6CP_COMP
450 wo->neg_vj = 1;
451 ao->neg_vj = 1;
452 wo->vj_protocol = IPV6CP_COMP;
453#endif
454
455}
456
457
458/*
459 * ipv6cp_open - IPV6CP is allowed to come up.
460 */
461static void
462ipv6cp_open(unit)
463 int unit;
464{
465 fsm_open(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit]);
466}
467
468
469/*
470 * ipv6cp_close - Take IPV6CP down.
471 */
472static void
473ipv6cp_close(unit, reason)
474 int unit;
475 char *reason;
476{
477 fsm_close(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit], reason);
478}
479
480
481/*
482 * ipv6cp_lowerup - The lower layer is up.
483 */
484static void
485ipv6cp_lowerup(unit)
486 int unit;
487{
488 fsm_lowerup(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit]);
489}
490
491
492/*
493 * ipv6cp_lowerdown - The lower layer is down.
494 */
495static void
496ipv6cp_lowerdown(unit)
497 int unit;
498{
499 fsm_lowerdown(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit]);
500}
501
502
503/*
504 * ipv6cp_input - Input IPV6CP packet.
505 */
506static void
507ipv6cp_input(unit, p, len)
508 int unit;
509 u_char *p;
510 int len;
511{
512 fsm_input(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit], p, len);
513}
514
515
516/*
517 * ipv6cp_protrej - A Protocol-Reject was received for IPV6CP.
518 *
519 * Pretend the lower layer went down, so we shut up.
520 */
521static void
522ipv6cp_protrej(unit)
523 int unit;
524{
525 fsm_lowerdown(&ipv6cp_fsm[unit]);
526}
527
528
529/*
530 * ipv6cp_resetci - Reset our CI.
531 */
532static void
533ipv6cp_resetci(f)
534 fsm *f;
535{
536 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[f->unit];
537 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
538
539 wo->req_ifaceid = wo->neg_ifaceid && ipv6cp_allowoptions[f->unit].neg_ifaceid;
540
541 if (!wo->opt_local) {
542 eui64_magic_nz(wo->ourid);
543 }
544
545 *go = *wo;
546 eui64_zero(go->hisid); /* last proposed interface identifier */
547}
548
549
550/*
551 * ipv6cp_cilen - Return length of our CI.
552 */
553static int
554ipv6cp_cilen(f)
555 fsm *f;
556{
557 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
558
559#define LENCIVJ(neg) (neg ? CILEN_COMPRESS : 0)
560#define LENCIIFACEID(neg) (neg ? CILEN_IFACEID : 0)
561
562 return (LENCIIFACEID(go->neg_ifaceid) +
563 LENCIVJ(go->neg_vj));
564}
565
566
567/*
568 * ipv6cp_addci - Add our desired CIs to a packet.
569 */
570static void
571ipv6cp_addci(f, ucp, lenp)
572 fsm *f;
573 u_char *ucp;
574 int *lenp;
575{
576 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
577 int len = *lenp;
578
579#define ADDCIVJ(opt, neg, val) \
580 if (neg) { \
581 int vjlen = CILEN_COMPRESS; \
582 if (len >= vjlen) { \
583 PUTCHAR(opt, ucp); \
584 PUTCHAR(vjlen, ucp); \
585 PUTSHORT(val, ucp); \
586 len -= vjlen; \
587 } else \
588 neg = 0; \
589 }
590
591#define ADDCIIFACEID(opt, neg, val1) \
592 if (neg) { \
593 int idlen = CILEN_IFACEID; \
594 if (len >= idlen) { \
595 PUTCHAR(opt, ucp); \
596 PUTCHAR(idlen, ucp); \
597 eui64_put(val1, ucp); \
598 len -= idlen; \
599 } else \
600 neg = 0; \
601 }
602
603 ADDCIIFACEID(CI_IFACEID, go->neg_ifaceid, go->ourid);
604
605 ADDCIVJ(CI_COMPRESSTYPE, go->neg_vj, go->vj_protocol);
606
607 *lenp -= len;
608}
609
610
611/*
612 * ipv6cp_ackci - Ack our CIs.
613 *
614 * Returns:
615 * 0 - Ack was bad.
616 * 1 - Ack was good.
617 */
618static int
619ipv6cp_ackci(f, p, len)
620 fsm *f;
621 u_char *p;
622 int len;
623{
624 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
625 u_short cilen, citype, cishort;
626 eui64_t ifaceid;
627
628 /*
629 * CIs must be in exactly the same order that we sent...
630 * Check packet length and CI length at each step.
631 * If we find any deviations, then this packet is bad.
632 */
633
634#define ACKCIVJ(opt, neg, val) \
635 if (neg) { \
636 int vjlen = CILEN_COMPRESS; \
637 if ((len -= vjlen) < 0) \
638 goto bad; \
639 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
640 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
641 if (cilen != vjlen || \
642 citype != opt) \
643 goto bad; \
644 GETSHORT(cishort, p); \
645 if (cishort != val) \
646 goto bad; \
647 }
648
649#define ACKCIIFACEID(opt, neg, val1) \
650 if (neg) { \
651 int idlen = CILEN_IFACEID; \
652 if ((len -= idlen) < 0) \
653 goto bad; \
654 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
655 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
656 if (cilen != idlen || \
657 citype != opt) \
658 goto bad; \
659 eui64_get(ifaceid, p); \
660 if (! eui64_equals(val1, ifaceid)) \
661 goto bad; \
662 }
663
664 ACKCIIFACEID(CI_IFACEID, go->neg_ifaceid, go->ourid);
665
666 ACKCIVJ(CI_COMPRESSTYPE, go->neg_vj, go->vj_protocol);
667
668 /*
669 * If there are any remaining CIs, then this packet is bad.
670 */
671 if (len != 0)
672 goto bad;
673 return (1);
674
675bad:
676 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp_ackci: received bad Ack!"));
677 return (0);
678}
679
680/*
681 * ipv6cp_nakci - Peer has sent a NAK for some of our CIs.
682 * This should not modify any state if the Nak is bad
683 * or if IPV6CP is in the OPENED state.
684 *
685 * Returns:
686 * 0 - Nak was bad.
687 * 1 - Nak was good.
688 */
689static int
690ipv6cp_nakci(f, p, len, treat_as_reject)
691 fsm *f;
692 u_char *p;
693 int len;
694 int treat_as_reject;
695{
696 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
697 u_char citype, cilen, *next;
698 u_short cishort;
699 eui64_t ifaceid;
700 ipv6cp_options no; /* options we've seen Naks for */
701 ipv6cp_options try; /* options to request next time */
702
703 BZERO(&no, sizeof(no));
704 try = *go;
705
706 /*
707 * Any Nak'd CIs must be in exactly the same order that we sent.
708 * Check packet length and CI length at each step.
709 * If we find any deviations, then this packet is bad.
710 */
711#define NAKCIIFACEID(opt, neg, code) \
712 if (go->neg && \
713 len >= (cilen = CILEN_IFACEID) && \
714 p[1] == cilen && \
715 p[0] == opt) { \
716 len -= cilen; \
717 INCPTR(2, p); \
718 eui64_get(ifaceid, p); \
719 no.neg = 1; \
720 code \
721 }
722
723#define NAKCIVJ(opt, neg, code) \
724 if (go->neg && \
725 ((cilen = p[1]) == CILEN_COMPRESS) && \
726 len >= cilen && \
727 p[0] == opt) { \
728 len -= cilen; \
729 INCPTR(2, p); \
730 GETSHORT(cishort, p); \
731 no.neg = 1; \
732 code \
733 }
734
735 /*
736 * Accept the peer's idea of {our,his} interface identifier, if different
737 * from our idea, only if the accept_{local,remote} flag is set.
738 */
739 NAKCIIFACEID(CI_IFACEID, neg_ifaceid,
740 if (treat_as_reject) {
741 try.neg_ifaceid = 0;
742 } else if (go->accept_local) {
743 while (eui64_iszero(ifaceid) ||
744 eui64_equals(ifaceid, go->hisid)) /* bad luck */
745 eui64_magic(ifaceid);
746 try.ourid = ifaceid;
747 IPV6CPDEBUG(("local LL address %s", llv6_ntoa(ifaceid)));
748 }
749 );
750
751#ifdef IPV6CP_COMP
752 NAKCIVJ(CI_COMPRESSTYPE, neg_vj,
753 {
754 if (cishort == IPV6CP_COMP && !treat_as_reject) {
755 try.vj_protocol = cishort;
756 } else {
757 try.neg_vj = 0;
758 }
759 }
760 );
761#else
762 NAKCIVJ(CI_COMPRESSTYPE, neg_vj,
763 {
764 try.neg_vj = 0;
765 }
766 );
767#endif
768
769 /*
770 * There may be remaining CIs, if the peer is requesting negotiation
771 * on an option that we didn't include in our request packet.
772 * If they want to negotiate about interface identifier, we comply.
773 * If they want us to ask for compression, we refuse.
774 */
775 while (len >= CILEN_VOID) {
776 GETCHAR(citype, p);
777 GETCHAR(cilen, p);
778 if ( cilen < CILEN_VOID || (len -= cilen) < 0 )
779 goto bad;
780 next = p + cilen - 2;
781
782 switch (citype) {
783 case CI_COMPRESSTYPE:
784 if (go->neg_vj || no.neg_vj ||
785 (cilen != CILEN_COMPRESS))
786 goto bad;
787 no.neg_vj = 1;
788 break;
789 case CI_IFACEID:
790 if (go->neg_ifaceid || no.neg_ifaceid || cilen != CILEN_IFACEID)
791 goto bad;
792 try.neg_ifaceid = 1;
793 eui64_get(ifaceid, p);
794 if (go->accept_local) {
795 while (eui64_iszero(ifaceid) ||
796 eui64_equals(ifaceid, go->hisid)) /* bad luck */
797 eui64_magic(ifaceid);
798 try.ourid = ifaceid;
799 }
800 no.neg_ifaceid = 1;
801 break;
802 }
803 p = next;
804 }
805
806 /* If there is still anything left, this packet is bad. */
807 if (len != 0)
808 goto bad;
809
810 /*
811 * OK, the Nak is good. Now we can update state.
812 */
813 if (f->state != OPENED)
814 *go = try;
815
816 return 1;
817
818bad:
819 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp_nakci: received bad Nak!"));
820 return 0;
821}
822
823
824/*
825 * ipv6cp_rejci - Reject some of our CIs.
826 */
827static int
828ipv6cp_rejci(f, p, len)
829 fsm *f;
830 u_char *p;
831 int len;
832{
833 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
834 u_char cilen;
835 u_short cishort;
836 eui64_t ifaceid;
837 ipv6cp_options try; /* options to request next time */
838
839 try = *go;
840 /*
841 * Any Rejected CIs must be in exactly the same order that we sent.
842 * Check packet length and CI length at each step.
843 * If we find any deviations, then this packet is bad.
844 */
845#define REJCIIFACEID(opt, neg, val1) \
846 if (go->neg && \
847 len >= (cilen = CILEN_IFACEID) && \
848 p[1] == cilen && \
849 p[0] == opt) { \
850 len -= cilen; \
851 INCPTR(2, p); \
852 eui64_get(ifaceid, p); \
853 /* Check rejected value. */ \
854 if (! eui64_equals(ifaceid, val1)) \
855 goto bad; \
856 try.neg = 0; \
857 }
858
859#define REJCIVJ(opt, neg, val) \
860 if (go->neg && \
861 p[1] == CILEN_COMPRESS && \
862 len >= p[1] && \
863 p[0] == opt) { \
864 len -= p[1]; \
865 INCPTR(2, p); \
866 GETSHORT(cishort, p); \
867 /* Check rejected value. */ \
868 if (cishort != val) \
869 goto bad; \
870 try.neg = 0; \
871 }
872
873 REJCIIFACEID(CI_IFACEID, neg_ifaceid, go->ourid);
874
875 REJCIVJ(CI_COMPRESSTYPE, neg_vj, go->vj_protocol);
876
877 /*
878 * If there are any remaining CIs, then this packet is bad.
879 */
880 if (len != 0)
881 goto bad;
882 /*
883 * Now we can update state.
884 */
885 if (f->state != OPENED)
886 *go = try;
887 return 1;
888
889bad:
890 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp_rejci: received bad Reject!"));
891 return 0;
892}
893
894
895/*
896 * ipv6cp_reqci - Check the peer's requested CIs and send appropriate response.
897 *
898 * Returns: CONFACK, CONFNAK or CONFREJ and input packet modified
899 * appropriately. If reject_if_disagree is non-zero, doesn't return
900 * CONFNAK; returns CONFREJ if it can't return CONFACK.
901 */
902static int
903ipv6cp_reqci(f, inp, len, reject_if_disagree)
904 fsm *f;
905 u_char *inp; /* Requested CIs */
906 int *len; /* Length of requested CIs */
907 int reject_if_disagree;
908{
909 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[f->unit];
910 ipv6cp_options *ho = &ipv6cp_hisoptions[f->unit];
911 ipv6cp_options *ao = &ipv6cp_allowoptions[f->unit];
912 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
913 u_char *cip, *next; /* Pointer to current and next CIs */
914 u_short cilen, citype; /* Parsed len, type */
915 u_short cishort; /* Parsed short value */
916 eui64_t ifaceid; /* Parsed interface identifier */
917 int rc = CONFACK; /* Final packet return code */
918 int orc; /* Individual option return code */
919 u_char *p; /* Pointer to next char to parse */
920 u_char *ucp = inp; /* Pointer to current output char */
921 int l = *len; /* Length left */
922
923 /*
924 * Reset all his options.
925 */
926 BZERO(ho, sizeof(*ho));
927
928 /*
929 * Process all his options.
930 */
931 next = inp;
932 while (l) {
933 orc = CONFACK; /* Assume success */
934 cip = p = next; /* Remember begining of CI */
935 if (l < 2 || /* Not enough data for CI header or */
936 p[1] < 2 || /* CI length too small or */
937 p[1] > l) { /* CI length too big? */
938 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp_reqci: bad CI length!"));
939 orc = CONFREJ; /* Reject bad CI */
940 cilen = l; /* Reject till end of packet */
941 l = 0; /* Don't loop again */
942 goto endswitch;
943 }
944 GETCHAR(citype, p); /* Parse CI type */
945 GETCHAR(cilen, p); /* Parse CI length */
946 l -= cilen; /* Adjust remaining length */
947 next += cilen; /* Step to next CI */
948
949 switch (citype) { /* Check CI type */
950 case CI_IFACEID:
951 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp: received interface identifier "));
952
953 if (!ao->neg_ifaceid ||
954 cilen != CILEN_IFACEID) { /* Check CI length */
955 orc = CONFREJ; /* Reject CI */
956 break;
957 }
958
959 /*
960 * If he has no interface identifier, or if we both have same
961 * identifier then NAK it with new idea.
962 * In particular, if we don't know his identifier, but he does,
963 * then accept it.
964 */
965 eui64_get(ifaceid, p);
966 IPV6CPDEBUG(("(%s)", llv6_ntoa(ifaceid)));
967 if (eui64_iszero(ifaceid) && eui64_iszero(go->ourid)) {
968 orc = CONFREJ; /* Reject CI */
969 break;
970 }
971 if (!eui64_iszero(wo->hisid) &&
972 !eui64_equals(ifaceid, wo->hisid) &&
973 eui64_iszero(go->hisid)) {
974
975 orc = CONFNAK;
976 ifaceid = wo->hisid;
977 go->hisid = ifaceid;
978 DECPTR(sizeof(ifaceid), p);
979 eui64_put(ifaceid, p);
980 } else
981 if (eui64_iszero(ifaceid) || eui64_equals(ifaceid, go->ourid)) {
982 orc = CONFNAK;
983 if (eui64_iszero(go->hisid)) /* first time, try option */
984 ifaceid = wo->hisid;
985 while (eui64_iszero(ifaceid) ||
986 eui64_equals(ifaceid, go->ourid)) /* bad luck */
987 eui64_magic(ifaceid);
988 go->hisid = ifaceid;
989 DECPTR(sizeof(ifaceid), p);
990 eui64_put(ifaceid, p);
991 }
992
993 ho->neg_ifaceid = 1;
994 ho->hisid = ifaceid;
995 break;
996
997 case CI_COMPRESSTYPE:
998 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp: received COMPRESSTYPE "));
999 if (!ao->neg_vj ||
1000 (cilen != CILEN_COMPRESS)) {
1001 orc = CONFREJ;
1002 break;
1003 }
1004 GETSHORT(cishort, p);
1005 IPV6CPDEBUG(("(%d)", cishort));
1006
1007#ifdef IPV6CP_COMP
1008 if (!(cishort == IPV6CP_COMP)) {
1009 orc = CONFREJ;
1010 break;
1011 }
1012
1013 ho->neg_vj = 1;
1014 ho->vj_protocol = cishort;
1015 break;
1016#else
1017 orc = CONFREJ;
1018 break;
1019#endif
1020
1021 default:
1022 orc = CONFREJ;
1023 break;
1024 }
1025
1026endswitch:
1027 IPV6CPDEBUG((" (%s)\n", CODENAME(orc)));
1028
1029 if (orc == CONFACK && /* Good CI */
1030 rc != CONFACK) /* but prior CI wasnt? */
1031 continue; /* Don't send this one */
1032
1033 if (orc == CONFNAK) { /* Nak this CI? */
1034 if (reject_if_disagree) /* Getting fed up with sending NAKs? */
1035 orc = CONFREJ; /* Get tough if so */
1036 else {
1037 if (rc == CONFREJ) /* Rejecting prior CI? */
1038 continue; /* Don't send this one */
1039 if (rc == CONFACK) { /* Ack'd all prior CIs? */
1040 rc = CONFNAK; /* Not anymore... */
1041 ucp = inp; /* Backup */
1042 }
1043 }
1044 }
1045
1046 if (orc == CONFREJ && /* Reject this CI */
1047 rc != CONFREJ) { /* but no prior ones? */
1048 rc = CONFREJ;
1049 ucp = inp; /* Backup */
1050 }
1051
1052 /* Need to move CI? */
1053 if (ucp != cip)
1054 BCOPY(cip, ucp, cilen); /* Move it */
1055
1056 /* Update output pointer */
1057 INCPTR(cilen, ucp);
1058 }
1059
1060 /*
1061 * If we aren't rejecting this packet, and we want to negotiate
1062 * their identifier and they didn't send their identifier, then we
1063 * send a NAK with a CI_IFACEID option appended. We assume the
1064 * input buffer is long enough that we can append the extra
1065 * option safely.
1066 */
1067 if (rc != CONFREJ && !ho->neg_ifaceid &&
1068 wo->req_ifaceid && !reject_if_disagree) {
1069 if (rc == CONFACK) {
1070 rc = CONFNAK;
1071 ucp = inp; /* reset pointer */
1072 wo->req_ifaceid = 0; /* don't ask again */
1073 }
1074 PUTCHAR(CI_IFACEID, ucp);
1075 PUTCHAR(CILEN_IFACEID, ucp);
1076 eui64_put(wo->hisid, ucp);
1077 }
1078
1079 *len = ucp - inp; /* Compute output length */
1080 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp: returning Configure-%s", CODENAME(rc)));
1081 return (rc); /* Return final code */
1082}
1083
1084
1085/*
1086 * ipv6_check_options - check that any IP-related options are OK,
1087 * and assign appropriate defaults.
1088 */
1089static void
1090ipv6_check_options()
1091{
1092 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[0];
1093
1094 if (!ipv6cp_protent.enabled_flag)
1095 return;
1096
1097 /*
1098 * Persistent link-local id is only used when user has not explicitly
1099 * configure/hard-code the id
1100 */
1101 if ((wo->use_persistent) && (!wo->opt_local) && (!wo->opt_remote)) {
1102
1103 /*
1104 * On systems where there are no Ethernet interfaces used, there
1105 * may be other ways to obtain a persistent id. Right now, it
1106 * will fall back to using magic [see eui64_magic] below when
1107 * an EUI-48 from MAC address can't be obtained. Other possibilities
1108 * include obtaining EEPROM serial numbers, or some other unique
1109 * yet persistent number. On Sparc platforms, this is possible,
1110 * but too bad there's no standards yet for x86 machines.
1111 */
1112 if (ether_to_eui64(&wo->ourid)) {
1113 wo->opt_local = 1;
1114 }
1115 }
1116
1117 if (!wo->opt_local) { /* init interface identifier */
1118 if (wo->use_ip && eui64_iszero(wo->ourid)) {
1119 eui64_setlo32(wo->ourid, ntohl(ipcp_wantoptions[0].ouraddr));
1120 if (!eui64_iszero(wo->ourid))
1121 wo->opt_local = 1;
1122 }
1123
1124 while (eui64_iszero(wo->ourid))
1125 eui64_magic(wo->ourid);
1126 }
1127
1128 if (!wo->opt_remote) {
1129 if (wo->use_ip && eui64_iszero(wo->hisid)) {
1130 eui64_setlo32(wo->hisid, ntohl(ipcp_wantoptions[0].hisaddr));
1131 if (!eui64_iszero(wo->hisid))
1132 wo->opt_remote = 1;
1133 }
1134 }
1135
1136 if (demand && (eui64_iszero(wo->ourid) || eui64_iszero(wo->hisid))) {
1137 option_error("local/remote LL address required for demand-dialling\n");
1138 exit(EXIT_OPTION_ERROR);
1139 }
1140}
1141
1142
1143/*
1144 * ipv6_demand_conf - configure the interface as though
1145 * IPV6CP were up, for use with dial-on-demand.
1146 */
1147static int
1148ipv6_demand_conf(u)
1149 int u;
1150{
1151 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[u];
1152
1153 if (!sif6up(u))
1154 return 0;
1155 if (!sif6addr(u, wo->ourid, wo->hisid))
1156 return 0;
1157#if !defined(__linux__) && !(defined(SVR4) && (defined(SNI) || defined(__USLC__)))
1158 if (!sifup(u))
1159 return 0;
1160#endif
1161 if (!sifnpmode(u, PPP_IPV6, NPMODE_QUEUE))
1162 return 0;
1163
1164 notice("ipv6_demand_conf");
1165 notice("local LL address %s", llv6_ntoa(wo->ourid));
1166 notice("remote LL address %s", llv6_ntoa(wo->hisid));
1167
1168 return 1;
1169}
1170
1171
1172/*
1173 * ipv6cp_up - IPV6CP has come UP.
1174 *
1175 * Configure the IPv6 network interface appropriately and bring it up.
1176 */
1177static void
1178ipv6cp_up(f)
1179 fsm *f;
1180{
1181 ipv6cp_options *ho = &ipv6cp_hisoptions[f->unit];
1182 ipv6cp_options *go = &ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit];
1183 ipv6cp_options *wo = &ipv6cp_wantoptions[f->unit];
1184
1185 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp: up"));
1186
1187 /*
1188 * We must have a non-zero LL address for both ends of the link.
1189 */
1190 if (!ho->neg_ifaceid)
1191 ho->hisid = wo->hisid;
1192
1193 if(!no_ifaceid_neg) {
1194 if (eui64_iszero(ho->hisid)) {
1195 error("Could not determine remote LL address");
1196 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "Could not determine remote LL address");
1197 return;
1198 }
1199 if (eui64_iszero(go->ourid)) {
1200 error("Could not determine local LL address");
1201 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "Could not determine local LL address");
1202 return;
1203 }
1204 if (eui64_equals(go->ourid, ho->hisid)) {
1205 error("local and remote LL addresses are equal");
1206 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "local and remote LL addresses are equal");
1207 return;
1208 }
1209 }
1210 script_setenv("LLLOCAL", llv6_ntoa(go->ourid), 0);
1211 script_setenv("LLREMOTE", llv6_ntoa(ho->hisid), 0);
1212
1213#ifdef IPV6CP_COMP
1214 /* set tcp compression */
1215 sif6comp(f->unit, ho->neg_vj);
1216#endif
1217
1218 /*
1219 * If we are doing dial-on-demand, the interface is already
1220 * configured, so we put out any saved-up packets, then set the
1221 * interface to pass IPv6 packets.
1222 */
1223 if (demand) {
1224 if (! eui64_equals(go->ourid, wo->ourid) ||
1225 ! eui64_equals(ho->hisid, wo->hisid)) {
1226 if (! eui64_equals(go->ourid, wo->ourid))
1227 warn("Local LL address changed to %s",
1228 llv6_ntoa(go->ourid));
1229 if (! eui64_equals(ho->hisid, wo->hisid))
1230 warn("Remote LL address changed to %s",
1231 llv6_ntoa(ho->hisid));
1232 ipv6cp_clear_addrs(f->unit, go->ourid, ho->hisid);
1233
1234 /* Set the interface to the new addresses */
1235 if (!sif6addr(f->unit, go->ourid, ho->hisid)) {
1236 if (debug)
1237 warn("sif6addr failed");
1238 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "Interface configuration failed");
1239 return;
1240 }
1241
1242 }
1243 demand_rexmit(PPP_IPV6);
1244 sifnpmode(f->unit, PPP_IPV6, NPMODE_PASS);
1245
1246 } else {
1247 /* bring the interface up for IPv6 */
1248 if (!sif6up(f->unit)) {
1249 if (debug)
1250 warn("sif6up failed (IPV6)");
1251 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "Interface configuration failed");
1252 return;
1253 }
1254
1255 if (!sif6addr(f->unit, go->ourid, ho->hisid)) {
1256 if (debug)
1257 warn("sif6addr failed");
1258 ipv6cp_close(f->unit, "Interface configuration failed");
1259 return;
1260 }
1261 sifnpmode(f->unit, PPP_IPV6, NPMODE_PASS);
1262
1263 notice("local LL address %s", llv6_ntoa(go->ourid));
1264 notice("remote LL address %s", llv6_ntoa(ho->hisid));
1265 }
1266
1267 np_up(f->unit, PPP_IPV6);
1268 ipv6cp_is_up = 1;
1269
1270 notify(ipv6_up_notifier, 0);
1271 if (ipv6_up_hook)
1272 ipv6_up_hook();
1273
1274 /*
1275 * Execute the ipv6-up script, like this:
1276 * /etc/ppp/ipv6-up interface tty speed local-LL remote-LL
1277 */
1278 if (ipv6cp_script_state == s_down && ipv6cp_script_pid == 0) {
1279 ipv6cp_script_state = s_up;
1280 ipv6cp_script(_PATH_IPV6UP);
1281 }
1282}
1283
1284
1285/*
1286 * ipv6cp_down - IPV6CP has gone DOWN.
1287 *
1288 * Take the IPv6 network interface down, clear its addresses
1289 * and delete routes through it.
1290 */
1291static void
1292ipv6cp_down(f)
1293 fsm *f;
1294{
1295 IPV6CPDEBUG(("ipv6cp: down"));
1296 update_link_stats(f->unit);
1297 notify(ipv6_down_notifier, 0);
1298 if (ipv6_down_hook)
1299 ipv6_down_hook();
1300 if (ipv6cp_is_up) {
1301 ipv6cp_is_up = 0;
1302 np_down(f->unit, PPP_IPV6);
1303 }
1304#ifdef IPV6CP_COMP
1305 sif6comp(f->unit, 0);
1306#endif
1307
1308 /*
1309 * If we are doing dial-on-demand, set the interface
1310 * to queue up outgoing packets (for now).
1311 */
1312 if (demand) {
1313 sifnpmode(f->unit, PPP_IPV6, NPMODE_QUEUE);
1314 } else {
1315 sifnpmode(f->unit, PPP_IPV6, NPMODE_DROP);
1316#if !defined(__linux__) && !(defined(SVR4) && (defined(SNI) || defined(__USLC)))
1317 sif6down(f->unit);
1318#endif
1319 ipv6cp_clear_addrs(f->unit,
1320 ipv6cp_gotoptions[f->unit].ourid,
1321 ipv6cp_hisoptions[f->unit].hisid);
1322#if defined(__linux__)
1323 sif6down(f->unit);
1324#elif defined(SVR4) && (defined(SNI) || defined(__USLC))
1325 sifdown(f->unit);
1326#endif
1327 }
1328
1329 /* Execute the ipv6-down script */
1330 if (ipv6cp_script_state == s_up && ipv6cp_script_pid == 0) {
1331 ipv6cp_script_state = s_down;
1332 ipv6cp_script(_PATH_IPV6DOWN);
1333 }
1334}
1335
1336
1337/*
1338 * ipv6cp_clear_addrs() - clear the interface addresses, routes,
1339 * proxy neighbour discovery entries, etc.
1340 */
1341static void
1342ipv6cp_clear_addrs(unit, ourid, hisid)
1343 int unit;
1344 eui64_t ourid;
1345 eui64_t hisid;
1346{
1347 cif6addr(unit, ourid, hisid);
1348}
1349
1350
1351/*
1352 * ipv6cp_finished - possibly shut down the lower layers.
1353 */
1354static void
1355ipv6cp_finished(f)
1356 fsm *f;
1357{
1358 np_finished(f->unit, PPP_IPV6);
1359}
1360
1361
1362/*
1363 * ipv6cp_script_done - called when the ipv6-up or ipv6-down script
1364 * has finished.
1365 */
1366static void
1367ipv6cp_script_done(arg)
1368 void *arg;
1369{
1370 ipv6cp_script_pid = 0;
1371 switch (ipv6cp_script_state) {
1372 case s_up:
1373 if (ipv6cp_fsm[0].state != OPENED) {
1374 ipv6cp_script_state = s_down;
1375 ipv6cp_script(_PATH_IPV6DOWN);
1376 }
1377 break;
1378 case s_down:
1379 if (ipv6cp_fsm[0].state == OPENED) {
1380 ipv6cp_script_state = s_up;
1381 ipv6cp_script(_PATH_IPV6UP);
1382 }
1383 break;
1384 }
1385}
1386
1387
1388/*
1389 * ipv6cp_script - Execute a script with arguments
1390 * interface-name tty-name speed local-LL remote-LL.
1391 */
1392static void
1393ipv6cp_script(script)
1394 char *script;
1395{
1396 char strspeed[32], strlocal[32], strremote[32];
1397 char *argv[8];
1398
1399 snprintf(strspeed, sizeof(strspeed), "%d", baud_rate);
1400 strlcpy(strlocal, llv6_ntoa(ipv6cp_gotoptions[0].ourid), sizeof(strlocal));
1401 strlcpy(strremote, llv6_ntoa(ipv6cp_hisoptions[0].hisid),
1402 sizeof(strremote));
1403
1404 argv[0] = script;
1405 argv[1] = ifname;
1406 argv[2] = devnam;
1407 argv[3] = strspeed;
1408 argv[4] = strlocal;
1409 argv[5] = strremote;
1410 argv[6] = ipparam;
1411 argv[7] = NULL;
1412
1413 ipv6cp_script_pid = run_program(script, argv, 0, ipv6cp_script_done,
1414 NULL, 0);
1415}
1416
1417/*
1418 * ipv6cp_printpkt - print the contents of an IPV6CP packet.
1419 */
1420static char *ipv6cp_codenames[] = {
1421 "ConfReq", "ConfAck", "ConfNak", "ConfRej",
1422 "TermReq", "TermAck", "CodeRej"
1423};
1424
1425static int
1426ipv6cp_printpkt(p, plen, printer, arg)
1427 u_char *p;
1428 int plen;
1429 void (*printer) __P((void *, char *, ...));
1430 void *arg;
1431{
1432 int code, id, len, olen;
1433 u_char *pstart, *optend;
1434 u_short cishort;
1435 eui64_t ifaceid;
1436
1437 if (plen < HEADERLEN)
1438 return 0;
1439 pstart = p;
1440 GETCHAR(code, p);
1441 GETCHAR(id, p);
1442 GETSHORT(len, p);
1443 if (len < HEADERLEN || len > plen)
1444 return 0;
1445
1446 if (code >= 1 && code <= sizeof(ipv6cp_codenames) / sizeof(char *))
1447 printer(arg, " %s", ipv6cp_codenames[code-1]);
1448 else
1449 printer(arg, " code=0x%x", code);
1450 printer(arg, " id=0x%x", id);
1451 len -= HEADERLEN;
1452 switch (code) {
1453 case CONFREQ:
1454 case CONFACK:
1455 case CONFNAK:
1456 case CONFREJ:
1457 /* print option list */
1458 while (len >= 2) {
1459 GETCHAR(code, p);
1460 GETCHAR(olen, p);
1461 p -= 2;
1462 if (olen < 2 || olen > len) {
1463 break;
1464 }
1465 printer(arg, " <");
1466 len -= olen;
1467 optend = p + olen;
1468 switch (code) {
1469 case CI_COMPRESSTYPE:
1470 if (olen >= CILEN_COMPRESS) {
1471 p += 2;
1472 GETSHORT(cishort, p);
1473 printer(arg, "compress ");
1474 printer(arg, "0x%x", cishort);
1475 }
1476 break;
1477 case CI_IFACEID:
1478 if (olen == CILEN_IFACEID) {
1479 p += 2;
1480 eui64_get(ifaceid, p);
1481 printer(arg, "addr %s", llv6_ntoa(ifaceid));
1482 }
1483 break;
1484 }
1485 while (p < optend) {
1486 GETCHAR(code, p);
1487 printer(arg, " %.2x", code);
1488 }
1489 printer(arg, ">");
1490 }
1491 break;
1492
1493 case TERMACK:
1494 case TERMREQ:
1495 if (len > 0 && *p >= ' ' && *p < 0x7f) {
1496 printer(arg, " ");
1497 print_string((char *)p, len, printer, arg);
1498 p += len;
1499 len = 0;
1500 }
1501 break;
1502 }
1503
1504 /* print the rest of the bytes in the packet */
1505 for (; len > 0; --len) {
1506 GETCHAR(code, p);
1507 printer(arg, " %.2x", code);
1508 }
1509
1510 return p - pstart;
1511}
1512
1513/*
1514 * ipv6_active_pkt - see if this IP packet is worth bringing the link up for.
1515 * We don't bring the link up for IP fragments or for TCP FIN packets
1516 * with no data.
1517 */
1518#define IP6_HDRLEN 40 /* bytes */
1519#define IP6_NHDR_FRAG 44 /* fragment IPv6 header */
1520#define TCP_HDRLEN 20
1521#define TH_FIN 0x01
1522
1523/*
1524 * We use these macros because the IP header may be at an odd address,
1525 * and some compilers might use word loads to get th_off or ip_hl.
1526 */
1527
1528#define get_ip6nh(x) (((unsigned char *)(x))[6])
1529#define get_tcpoff(x) (((unsigned char *)(x))[12] >> 4)
1530#define get_tcpflags(x) (((unsigned char *)(x))[13])
1531
1532static int
1533ipv6_active_pkt(pkt, len)
1534 u_char *pkt;
1535 int len;
1536{
1537 u_char *tcp;
1538
1539 len -= PPP_HDRLEN;
1540 pkt += PPP_HDRLEN;
1541 if (len < IP6_HDRLEN)
1542 return 0;
1543 if (get_ip6nh(pkt) == IP6_NHDR_FRAG)
1544 return 0;
1545 if (get_ip6nh(pkt) != IPPROTO_TCP)
1546 return 1;
1547 if (len < IP6_HDRLEN + TCP_HDRLEN)
1548 return 0;
1549 tcp = pkt + IP6_HDRLEN;
1550 if ((get_tcpflags(tcp) & TH_FIN) != 0 && len == IP6_HDRLEN + get_tcpoff(tcp) * 4)
1551 return 0;
1552 return 1;
1553}
